New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a career-high 47th homer in the first inning
Will Smith, Max Muncy, and Tommy Edman hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning
Pete Crow-Armstrong's single tied the score 7-7
Gavin Lux's clutch, two-out RBI single in the seventh gave the Dodgers a 10-7 lead
Michael Kopech survived a harrowing ninth, walking the first three batters before getting Paredes to hit a sacrifice fly to right
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers might want to add another giveaway item to the promotional calendar: chest protector night, with free catcher’s gear for fans in the right-field pavilion at Dodger Stadium
Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The showdown between Clayton Kershaw and Mookie Betts was highly anticipated
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Right-hander Bobby Miller gave up six runs and five hits in 4-1/3 innings
Teoscar Hernández returned to the lineup
